stepitem.steptxt: Install the battery cover with the tab facing up.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Push the entire edge of the battery cover into the key.

stepitem.steptxt: Install the key cover.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Align the key cover with the key and then press it straight into the key.
Make sure that the key cover is securely installed without any gaps between it and the key.

stepitem.steptxt: Operate the or switch and check that the doors can be locked/unlocked.

paraselectitem.title: Vehicles with a smart key system

stepitem.steptxt: Release the lock and remove the mechanical key.
Remove the key cover.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To prevent damage to the key, cover the tip of the flathead screwdriver with a rag.

stepitem.steptxt: Remove the depleted battery using a small flathead screwdriver.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: When removing the cover, the electronic key module may stick to the cover and the battery may not be visible. In this case, remove the electronic key module in order to remove the battery.
Insert a new battery with the “+” terminal facing up.

stepitem.steptxt: When installing the key cover and mechanical key, install by conducting step 2 and step 1 with the directions reversed.
Operate the or switch and check that the doors can be locked/unlocked.

attention_para.title: Battery precautions
attention_para.p: Observe the following precautions. Failure to do so may result in death or serious injury.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Do not swallow the battery. Doing so may cause chemical burns.
A coin battery or button battery is used in the key. If a battery is swallowed, it may cause severe chemical burns in as little as 2 hours and may result in death or serious injury.
Keep away new and removed batteries from children.
If the cover cannot be firmly closed, stop using the key and stow the key in the place where children cannot reach, and then contact your Toyota dealer.
If you accidentally swallow a battery or put a battery into a part of your body, get emergency medical attention immediately.

attention_para.title: To prevent battery explosion or leakage of flammable liquid or gas

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Replace the battery with a new battery of the same type. If a wrong type of battery is used, it may explode.
Do not expose batteries to extremely low pressure due to high altitude or extremely high temperatures.
Do not burn, break or cut a battery.

attention_para.title: When replacing the battery
attention_para.p: Use a flathead screwdriver of appropriate size. Applying excessive force may deform or damage the cover.

attention_para.title: For normal operation after replacing the battery
attention_para.p: Observe the following precautions to prevent accidents:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Always work with dry hands. Moisture may cause the battery to rust.
Do not touch or move any other component inside the remote control.
Do not bend either of the battery terminals.

attention_para.title: When removing the battery cover (vehicles without a smart key system)
attention_para.p: Do not forcibly remove the battery cover, otherwise it may be damaged. If the battery cover is difficult to remove, lift the edge to remove it.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: If any of the electrical components do not operate, a fuse may have blown. If this happens, check and replace the fuses as necessary.

stepitem.steptxt: Turn the engine switch off.
Open the fuse box cover.

list1_item.itemtxt: Engine compartment: type A fuse box
list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Push the tabs in and lift the lid off.

list1_item.itemtxt: Engine compartment: type B fuse box
list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Push the tabs in and lift the lid off.

list1_item.itemtxt: Under the driver’s side instrument panel
list1_item.itemtxt_sub: Make sure to push the claw when removing/installing the lid.

stepitem.steptxt: Remove the fuse with the pullout tool. Only type A fuse can be removed using the pullout tool.
Check if the fuse is blown.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Replace the blown fuse with a new fuse of an appropriate amperage rating. The amperage rating can be found on the fuse box lid.

list1_item.itemtxt: Type A
Type B
Type C
Type D
Type E

att_list1_item.itemtxt: When installing the lid, make sure that the tab is installed securely.
If the replaced fuse blows again, have the vehicle inspected by your Toyota dealer.

note_para.title: If there is an overload in a circuit
note_para.p: The fuses are designed to blow, protecting the wiring harness from damage.

note_para.title: When replacing light bulbs
note_para.p: Toyota recommends that you use genuine Toyota products designed for this vehicle. Because certain bulbs are connected to circuits designed to prevent overload, non-genuine parts or parts not designed for this vehicle may be unusable.

attention_para.title: To prevent system breakdowns and vehicle fire
attention_para.p: Observe the following precautions. Failure to do so may cause damage to the vehicle, and possibly a fire or injury.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Never use a fuse of a higher amperage rating than that indicated, or use any other object in place of a fuse.
Always use a genuine Toyota fuse or equivalent. Never replace a fuse with a wire, even as a temporary fix.
Do not modify the fuses or fuse boxes.

attention_para.title: Before replacing fuses
attention_para.p: Have the cause of electrical overload determined and repaired by your Toyota dealer as soon as possible.

titlegroupcell.title: Headlight aim (vehicles with front side marker lights [bulb type])

list1_item.itemtxt: Make sure the vehicle has a full tank of gasoline and the area around the headlight is not deformed.
Park the vehicle on level ground.
Make sure the tire inflation pressure is at the specified level.
Have someone sit in the driver’s seat.
Bounce the vehicle several times.

stepitem.steptxt: Using a Phillips-head screwdriver, turn bolt A in either direction.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Remember the turning direction and the number of turns.

stepitem.steptxt: Turn bolt B the same number of turns and in the same direction as step 1.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: If the headlight cannot be adjusted using this procedure, take the vehicle to your Toyota dealer to adjust the headlight aim.

paratablecell.paratabletxt: You may replace the following bulbs yourself. The difficulty level of replacement varies depending on the bulb. If necessary bulb replacement seems difficult to perform, contact your Toyota dealer.
For more information about replacing other light bulbs, contact your Toyota dealer.

om_body.p: Check the wattage of the light bulb to be replaced. (→ )

calloutitem.callouttxt: Front turn signal/parking lights (vehicles without side turn signal lights)

om_body.title: Bulbs that need to be replaced by your Toyota dealer

list1_item.itemtxt: Headlights/daytime running lights
Parking lights (vehicles with side turn signal lights)
Front turn signal lights (vehicles with side turn signal lights)
Front side marker lights (LED type)
LED accent lights (if equipped)
Side turn signal lights (if equipped)
Tail lights
Stop lights
Rear side marker lights (LED type)
High mounted stoplight
License plate lights

note_para.title: LED light bulbs
note_para.p: The lights other than the front turn signal lights/parking lights (vehicles without side turn signal lights), front side marker lights (bulb type), rear turn signal lights, rear side marker lights (bulb type) and back-up lights consist of a number of LEDs. If any of the LEDs burn out, take your vehicle to your Toyota dealer to have the light replaced.

note_para.title: Condensation build-up on the inside of the lens
note_para.p: In certain situations, such as when driving in the rain or when washing the vehicle, condensation may form on the inner side of the headlight lens and other lights. As each light has a ventilation hole, moist air may enter. If the ambient temperature is low, condensation may form temporarily, but it will dissipate as the inside of the light is warmed up. As the condensation is due to a phenomenon similar to windows fogging in the rain, it does not indicate a malfunction.
Contact your Toyota dealer for more information in the following situations:

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Large drops of water have built up on the inside of the lens.
Water has built up inside the headlight.

om_body.title: Front turn signal/parking lights (vehicles without side turn signal lights)

stepitem.steptxt: Turn the bulb base counterclockwise.

list1_item.itemtxt: Type A
Type B

stepitem.steptxt: Remove the light bulb.

list1_item.itemtxt: Type A
Type B

stepitem.steptxt: When installing, reverse the steps listed.
Turn the bulb base counterclockwise.
Remove the light bulb.
When installing, reverse the steps listed.

om_body.title: Rear turn signal lights and rear side marker lights (vehicles with blub type rear side marker lights)

stepitem.steptxt: Open the trunk lid.
Insert a flathead screwdriver between the cover and the light assembly and pry up the cover to disengage the claws (indicated by a dotted line).
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To prevent scratching the vehicle, wrap the tip of the flathead screwdriver with a cloth, etc.

stepitem.steptxt: Pull the cover toward the rear of the vehicle and remove the cover.
Remove the 2 screws and then remove the light assembly by pulling it straight back.
Turn the bulb base counterclockwise.
Remove the light bulb.
When installing the light bulb, install it by conducting steps 6 and 5 with the directions reversed.
Install the light assembly and then install the 2 screws.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Align the guide and pin on the light assembly with the mounting when installing it.

stepitem.steptxt: Install the cover.

om_body.title: Rear turn signal lights (vehicles with LED type rear side marker lights)

stepitem.steptxt: Open the trunk lid.
Insert a flathead screwdriver between the cover and the light assembly and pry up the cover to disengage the claws (indicated by a dotted line).
stepitem.steptxt_sub: To prevent scratching the vehicle, wrap the tip of the flathead screwdriver with a cloth, etc.

stepitem.steptxt: Pull the cover toward the rear of the vehicle and remove the cover.
Remove the 2 screws and then remove the light assembly by pulling it straight back.
Turn the bulb base counterclockwise.
Remove the light bulb.
When installing the light bulb, install it by conducting steps 6 and 5 with the directions reversed.
Install the light assembly and then install the 2 screws.
stepitem.steptxt_sub: Align the guide and pin on the light assembly with the mounting when installing it.

stepitem.steptxt: Install the cover.
Open the trunk lid, remove the clips, and pull back the cover.
Turn the bulb base counterclockwise and remove it.
Remove the light bulb.
When installing, reverse the steps listed.

att_list1_item.itemtxt: Turn off the lights. Do not attempt to replace the bulb immediately after turning off the lights. The bulbs become very hot and may cause burns.

Do not touch the glass portion of the light bulb with bare hands. When it is unavoidable to hold the glass portion, use and hold with a clean dry cloth to avoid getting moisture and oils on the bulb. Also, if the bulb is scratched or dropped, it may blow out or crack.

Fully install light bulbs and any parts used to secure them. Failure to do so may result in heat damage, fire, or water entering the light unit. This may damage the lights or cause condensation to build up on the lens.

attention_para.title: To prevent damage or fire
attention_para.p: Make sure bulbs are fully seated and locked.
